title: So, a lot of people have been starting to complain about Rylais.. (A Morde thread, again...)
body:
Let me start this off by saying I don't deny Rylais can be a real problem on certain champs.
Hell, playing against Azir with Rylais is one of the worst experiences there is in League but now that people are actually starting to demand nerfs to Rylais I just have to talk about the ONE champ who relies 100% on being able to get Rylais:

MORDEKAISER

Yes, Mordekaiser doesn't even feel like a real champion before he gets Rylais.
His entire kit as a no CC/NO Mobility Melee juggernaut is flawed and would never work if he wasn't able to get this item.

So, in the case that Riot decides to Nerf Rylais Mordekaiser will suffer heavily from it and may, depending on the changes, even fall beyond 40% win rate.

So, before a random PBE update indirectly destroys my favorite champs let's just try and explore some changes that can be made to Rylais to "combat" The "issue" of Mages abusing the item?

-Lower AP, increase HP
-Up gold cost (though it would hurt Morde a lot)
-Make the slow reduced for ranged/better for melee (my personal favorite if you were to change the slow amount)

But alas, Changing the item with regards to Morde might not work out so if the item does get nerfed Morde NEEDS to be compensated.
I suggest the following if this is the case:
-If HP gets nerfed; Beef up his base stats so that he doesn't die because he can't get an early bulk of hp
-If the slow gets nerfed; Give him more Movement Speed
-AP gets nerfed; Couldn't care less actually

Just me already getting his Jimmies rustled over the possibility that Rylais might get changed.

Taking these 20 champions into account makes it look like nerfing the slow on a ranged user is an acceptable fix.

EDIT: To all of the people out there saying, "But what about muh {{champion:69}} {{champion:63}} ?" I accept your complaints as valid responses, however I chose not to mention these champions for specific reasons. The one reason that pertains to both of them is that they build Rylai's simply because it is too strong right now. Ideally, Rylai's will be reduced in power to the point where it is a utility _option_ only built in situations where you need the health or disengage. The main reason every Brand builds Rylai's right now is that it is more gold efficient and more powerful than his other options, and that's not what balance looks like.

Let's be real here.
Frozen mallet's passive is less effective on ranged so why shouldn't Rylais?

I think the theory is that Frozen Mallet is applied using auto attacks, so ranged attackers have a much easier and safer time applying the slow, which is why they get less reward from it. Rylai's is dependent on spells, so auto attack range doesn't really have anything to do with how easily or safely they can apply it; instead the slow varies based on the type of spell so multi-target spells don't get too much value and DoT spells aren't crippling. I think that both items have the slow they provide vary in a reasonable way, and I don't think that a ranged versus a melee auto attack should be a deciding factor in an item that isn't related to auto attacks at all.

The thing that I think is different between them in an important way is that Frozen Mallet has a HUGE amount of HP turning it into a non-viable item for damage dealers. Rylai's has a lot less of its cost tied up in health, thus a lot more damage so it can be used efficiently in full-damage builds on champions that have sustained damage patterns, rather than as a defensive option or for champions that need real survivability and chase potential.

IMO Ludens and Runic Echoes need their AP ticked up by 20 again.

I am definitely ok with luden's / runic echo getting more AP. 

From my perspective, there should be 3 classes of items

burst items for getting the most out of your immediate (QWER in quick succession) single rotation (luden is here). With AOE and single target as sub categories. These should have the most AP, and the least CDR. They should also not have any low CD sheen procs nor should they offer any significant utility. 

DPS items for increasing your overall damage at the cost of single rotation burst. These should offer CDR and extra damage effects (lich bane, torment), but should not have as much AP. If these items have spell penetration it should be % bonus MR, not flat (I.E. against tanks, not against carries). The items should be balanced such that extra damage per rotation is only attained after 2+ spell rotations or 2+ procs of the "spell effect". Lich bane and torment belong here. These items can offer survivability. ROA and chalice are potentially here. 

Utility items where damage is sacrificed for play-making ability, awesome passives and actives. some of the "survival" items belong here, and also LCS, zonya, FQC. the idea is you get an awesome active that lets you do awesome stuff, and you have to give up your ability to put damage out to get it.

Permaslow is obnoxious, but is it gamebreaking?

I would propose a compromise. Here is the current text on Rylai's:

UNIQUE - Icy: Damaging abilities slow affected units based on their type:
Single Target: 40% for 1.5 seconds
Multi Target: 40% for 1 second
Damage over Time, Multi Hit, and Pet Attacks: 20% for 1 second

With the live iteration, Rylai's varies its slow strength and duration based off of spell targeting. This has enabled champions like Morde, Brand, and Malzahar to chain slow targets for 5-10 seconds, usually because their target simply stood too close. Here is my proposed new text:

UNIQUE - Icy: Damaging abilities slow affected units by a maximum of 40% for 1 second. Max slow is achieved at 200 range and decays by 5% every 100 additional range, to a minimum of 10%. Multi Target spells, Damage over Time spells, and Pet Attacks slow for half value.

With this iteration, champions like Malzahar and Singed will still be able to kite but not able to engage without other items like {{item:3152}} or {{item:3800}} . Landing a max range Azir Q (875 units) would now slow for only 5%, meaning he should just buy a Luden's if his plan is to poke. Additionally, if Mordekaiser or Brand land Children of the Grave or Conflagration respectively, flashing away from their other abilities means although you are slowed longer than 5 seconds, you are over 1000 units away and slowed by 5%, meaning you are practically home free.
